alert.note: Alert for Lake; Porter (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 12 at 5:21AM EST until January 13 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow, strong winds, and slippery travel expected early this morning and again tonight. Total snow accumulations between both periods of snow 2 to 5 inches, highest amounts northern portions of these counties. Wind gusts to around 45 mph expected late tonight. * WHERE...In Illinois, Kankakee, and Livingston counties. In Indiana, Lake and Porter Counties. * WHEN...Until noon CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will mix with and may change entirely to rain from mid morning to late this afternoon leading to some melting and compaction of the snow that falls this morning. Rain will change back to snow by early evening. Snow rates may exceed 1 inch per hour at times early this morning. Westerly wind gusts to around 45 mph are expected late this evening and overnight, possibly leading to blowing snow and reduced visibility.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. In Illinois, the latest road conditions for Illinois can be obtained on the internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com. In Indiana, the latest road conditions for Indiana are available by calling 1-800-261-7623.
